title: Data Scientist

description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and passionate Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data science and analytics with a keen interest in healthcare technology. You will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets to derive actionable insights, predict healthcare trends, and contribute to the development of data-driven healthcare solutions.

Responsibilities:
• Analyze large, complex data sets to extract meaningful insights and inform company strategies.
• Maintain and improve analytic models and algorithms to predict patient outcomes, optimize healthcare processes, and identify high-performing healthcare providers.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, product managers, and healthcare professionals, to integrate data-driven solutions into our products and services.
• Maintain the data pipeline in the CMS Virtual Research Data Center (VRDC) Databricks environment.
• Contribute to new data features and methodology.
• Assist with ad-hoc collaborative data projects.
• Design and conduct A/B tests to evaluate the effectiveness of models and strategies.
• Stay abreast of the latest developments in data science, machine learning, and healthcare technology to continuously innovate and improve our offerings.
• Ensure compliance with healthcare data regulations and standards, including HIPAA.

Qualifications:
• Master’s or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
• Proven experience as a Data Scientist, preferably in the healthcare sector.
• Strong knowledge of predictive modeling and statistical analysis techniques.
• Proficient in programming languages such as R (main language), Spark programming (secondary), SQL (secondary) and Python (tertiary).
• Experience with data visualization tools and techniques.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
• Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
• Knowledge of healthcare data privacy laws and regulations is a plus.

At Embold Health, we are steadfast in our commitment to fostering an environment that celebrates diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe that our strength lies in the uniqueness of our people, and we are dedicated to creating a workplace where everyone, regardless of their race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status, feels valued and respected. We recognize that diversity enriches our work culture and drives innovation, enabling us to better serve our clients, partners, and community.
